bibl.title: Two New Poems by Sappho.
bibl.note: P. Coll. privées [P. Sapph. Obbink], now in a private collection, London. A large fragment (176 x 111 mm) form a papyrus roll, contining parts of two poems (20 and 9 lines respectively). The handwriting (as well as format and line-spacing) is identical with P. GC. [P. Coll. privées: P. Green] Inv. 105 [edd.: Simon Burris, Jeffrey Fish & Dirk Obbink, New Fragments of Book 1 of Sappho, ZPE 189 (2014) pp. 1-28, 3 tabl., 1 pl.]. Third century AD. - The Papyrus. - Content. - Relation to Sappho fr. 5. - The New Poems and Sappho Book 1. - [Text.] - Palaeographical Notes. - Translation. - Commentary: Brothers Poem (P. Sapph. Obbink 1-20; P. Oxy. XXI, 2289 [= M.-P.3 1443; LDAB 3887], fr. 5); - Kypris Poem (P. Sapph. Obbink 21-9; P. Oxy. X, 1231 [= M.-P.3 1445; LDAB 3893], fr. 16).
bibl.seg: Dirk Obbink, Two New Poems by Sappho.

P. Coll. privées [P. Sapph. Obbink], now in a private collection, London. A large fragment (176 x 111 mm) form a papyrus roll, contining parts of two poems (20 and 9 lines respectively). The handwriting (as well as format and line-spacing) is identical with P. GC. [P. Coll. privées: P. Green] Inv. 105 [edd.: Simon Burris, Jeffrey Fish & Dirk Obbink, New Fragments of Book 1 of Sappho, ZPE 189 (2014) pp. 1-28, 3 tabl., 1 pl.]. Third century AD. - The Papyrus. - Content. - Relation to Sappho fr. 5. - The New Poems and Sappho Book 1. - [Text.] - Palaeographical Notes. - Translation. - Commentary: Brothers Poem (P. Sapph. Obbink 1-20; P. Oxy. XXI, 2289 [= M.-P.3 1443; LDAB 3887], fr. 5); - Kypris Poem (P. Sapph. Obbink 21-9; P. Oxy. X, 1231 [= M.-P.3 1445; LDAB 3893], fr. 16).
